snippet: For that matter, worker bees raised with limited access to pollen often get lost when foraging for flowers, which could hasten their decline.
abstract: Dr Heather Mattila and Hailey Scofield study in journal PLoS One concludes that worker bees that are not given access to adequate pollen early in life become poor foragers and communicators with other bees.
lead_paragraph: For that matter, worker bees raised with limited access to pollen often get lost when foraging for flowers, which could hasten their decline.

headline.print_headline: Insects: How Bees Lose Step in a Life-and-Death Dance
headline.main: Pollen-Deprived Bees Don’t Make Good Dancers
